data.title: New River Trail State Park
meta_keywords: This 57-mile-long linear park offers horse rentals
data.meta_description: This 57-mile-long linear park offers horse rentals, river tubing, hiking and biking, fishing, canoe and kayak rentals, camping and cabin rentals.
data.text:
Due to maintenance issues, the Shot Tower is closed for tours. The parking lot and restrooms remain available. Staff plan to continue point duty interpretation, weather dependent, on the decking outside entrance to answer questions on weekends (Saturday-Sundays).Attention New River users making plans on the water this July:

Appalachian Power is making repairs to one of the gates at the Byllesby Dam, which will temporarily impact New River users. Starting July 26, they will lower the Buck Dam reservoir by roughly 8 feet and close the Byllesby Public Boat Launch and Byllesby portage.

The repairs are expected to take 1-2 weeks; however, water conditions may alter this schedule. During this time, the last take-out point is at the Department of Wildlife Resources (DWR) boat landing on river left off Route 94 at Riverside Park in the town of Fries, and the next downstream put in point is at the Buck reservoir.

Find coordinates for all access sites at https://dwr.virginia.gov/boating/access/?find_by_waterbody=New%20River&fbclid=IwZXh0bgNhZW0CMTAAAR0bj84iUBMXP-xfaNWUCFWKz040G0HUDShkhjIGtUJUnka6MfYZCn7A6-g_aem_8lxWFFWBSC3C1y5uG3Uf-Q. Please plan your recreational activities on the New River accordingly.

Parts of the New River Trail are closed due to a major renovation project that necessitated the closing of several trestles. The project is currently impacting the following sections of the trail:

The Ivanhoe parking lot trestle is closed through August.

The trail is closed from the Highway 52 trestle to the Austinville access.

This content takes priority over any other information provided on this park's webpage.

The park is open daily from dawn to dusk. The park office is open Monday - Friday 8 a.m. - 4:30 p.m., closed state holidays. Call for the current schedule for the Cliffview office.

Depot Gift Shop:

Until May 26: Monday-Thursday, 9 a.m.-4 p.m; Friday-Saturday, 9 a.m.-6 p.m.

After Memorial Day: Monday-Thursday, 9 a.m.-5 p.m; Friday-Saturday, 9 a.m.-6 p.m.

Boat and Bike Livery:

April1-May 23: Friday-Sunday, 9:30 a.m.-5:30 p.m.

Memorial Day-Labor Day: Open daily, 9:30 a.m.-5:30 p.m.

Labor Day-Oct. 31: Friday-Sunday, 9:30 a.m.-5:30 p.m.

Nov.-March: closed

Contact Station: open for the season. Parking is $7 per standard vehicle. When the contact station is not staffed, use the self-pay envelope for cash or check and place in the honor safe. Credit cards can be used in the park office when open or by using the QR code self-pay app.

The horse arena is open.

Shot Tower:

Shot Tower grounds are open dawn to dusk.

Tours are free and offered 10 a.m.-5 p.m. on scheduled days. Standard parking fee applies.

Tour Schedule:

April13-May 19: Saturday and Sunday

Memorial Day weekend to Labor Day: Friday-Sunday

Sept. 7 - Oct 27: Saturday-Sunday

Overnight facilities are open for reservations.

Click here for information on the Inn at Foster Falls.

Please review the Virginia State Parks Know Before You Go information before you visit.
